data.benefits: Scheme provides 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 1 Lakhs) for conducting water audit and subsidy on cost of capital equipment required for Water Conservation/ Harvesting , subject to a maximum of Rs. 20 lakhs.
data.eligibility: All existing industrial units located anywhere in the State are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
1. The unit must have filed Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) and Haryana Udhyam Memorandum (HUM). 
  2. The item manufactured should not be on the restrictive list as notified by the State Government. 
  3. Assistance for capital equipment is only eligible if there is a 25% reduction in average monthly water consumption compared to the previous 12 months. 
  4. If water consumption increases due to higher production, the claim will be reviewed by a committee. 
  5. Only investments in plant, machinery, and equipment for water conservation are eligible for subsidy. 
  6. The unit must obtain No objection certificate from the competent authority, if applicable. The unit must be in commercial production. The unit must be in regular production at the time of disbursement.
data.beneficiaries: All existing industrial units located anywhere in the State are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. The unit must have filed Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) and Haryana Udhyam Memorandum (HUM). 
  2. The item manufactured should not be on the restrictive list as notified by the State Government. 
  3. Assistance for capital equipment is only eligible if there is a 25% reduction in average monthly water consumption compared to the previous 12 months. 
  4. If water consumption increases due to higher production, the claim will be reviewed by a committee. 
  5. Only investments in plant, machinery, and equipment for water conservation are eligible for subsidy. 
  6. The unit must obtain No objection certificate from the competent authority, if applicable. The unit must be in commercial production. The unit must be in regular production at the time of disbursement.
data.nodal_agency: Directorate of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Haryana
data.context: This scheme encourages MSMEs to take initiatives to conserve water.
data.objective: The objective of this scheme is to encourage the conservation of water in industrial units and encourage harvesting of water in the unit.
data.description:
Scheme provides : 

  • Water Audit Reimbursement : 75% or maximum Rs. 1 lakhs 
  • Subsidy on Capital Equipment : 50% or maximum Rs. 20 lakhs 

Note : No subsidy for energy audit if the recommendations are not implemented.
data.how_to_apply:
Application on prescribed Form (Annexure-II) for the reimbursement of expenses incurred in conducting water audit & purchase of capital equipment along with listed documents would be submitted to the Director/ Director General, Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, on the web portal of the department within three months from the date of completion of water audit/ purchase of capital equipment or from the date of notification of the scheme, whichever is later. 

Annexure-II: https://cdnbbsr.s3waas.gov.in/s3f48c04ffab49ff0e5d1176244fdfb65c/uploads/2022/06/2022060255-2.pdf
data.funding_facilitator: Directorate of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Haryana
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the benefits after the approval from the concerned auhtority.
data.additional_info:
Link of list of Restrictive Industries in Haryana: https://www.hsiidc.org.in/uploads/estate_managements/170097742718HEEP%20restrictive%20list.pdf 

Categorization of Blocks : https://investharyana.in/content/pdfs/Re-categorization%20of%20blocks%2015.11.2018.pdf
data.checklist_info_a:
Udyam Registration Certificate (URC)
Haryana Udhyam Memorandum (HUM)
NOC/CLU (No Objection Certificate/Change of Land Use)
Haryana Resident Certificate (for local employment benefits)
ESI/PF Registration Number
Proof of Commercial Production
Financial Statements (Balance Sheet, Profit & Loss Statement)
Import-Exporter Code (IEC)
Registration-cum-Membership Certificate (RCMC) from Export Promotion Council
Land Documents (ownership or lease agreement)
Environmental Clearances (if applicable)
Zero Defect Zero Effect (ZED) Certification
Proof of Investment (in machinery/equipment)
Electricity Bills (for electricity-related incentives)
Energy Audit Report (for energy efficiency claims)
Other Miscellaneous Documents (as per specific schemes)
